Key Match Events: Tyrese Haliburton went off for 25 points and 10 assists
Pascal Siakam broke away for consecutive dunks
The Warriors had a 7-minute stretch with just two points, allowing Indiana to stretch its lead to 14
Pre-Game Insights: The Warriors handle the veterans with caution on the second night of a back-to-back
Andrew Wiggins is home for personal reasons (though his absence isn’t expected to be long)
Jonathan Kuminga is out for at least two more weeks with a bad ankle sprain
Brandin Podziemski is still dealing with an abdominal strain and Gary Payton II is on the mend but not quite ready to return from a calf strain
Post-Match Reflections: “Shorthanded, back-to-back, guys did a great job of hanging in there,” Steve Kerr said postgame
Spencer impressed with a career-high 17 points off the bench, and Hield matched him

But they were no match for the Pacers’ All-Star caliber trio of Tyrese Haliburton (25 points, 10 assists), Pascal Siakam (25 points, 11 rebounds) and Myles Turner (11 points, seven rebounds, three blocks)
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Warriors activated two-way Quinten Post as a 10th player and involved both Gui Santos and Pat Spencer in the game plan
The Warriors racked up deflections, offensive rebounds and forced turnovers
They had a lot of hustle points, but not a lot of scoreboard points
